name: TheAtlantic
text: “He has seen the whole film, start to finish … in his head for probably a year.” The people behind the unusual look and sound of David Fincher’s “Mank” spoke with @davidlsims about translating the director’s creative visions into reality: https://t.co/qztm1LLt68

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: Investment strategies change over time. @BlackRock identifies 3 historic moments for the market that popularized indexing: https://t.co/34fQy0jd8v https://t.co/kZP5YF3DF5

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Lambasting people for their risky behavior may be effective in expressing frustration over a mismanaged pandemic, but it’s counterproductive to what really matters: reducing infections," @JuliaLMarcus writes: https://t.co/QwqvSBqE8C

name: TheAtlantic
text: Today, for the first time, states reported more than 3,000 COVID-19 deaths, writes @slaskow. The latest data from @COVID19Tracking: https://t.co/Fc3QZh9oCn

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED:  A 1978 shootout between Philadelphia police and Black back-to-nature group MOVE left one cop dead and nine MOVE members imprisoned. What can the conflict teach us about today's fight against police brutality? @HBODocs https://t.co/Sxmlx41d4C

name: TheAtlantic
text: Don’t worry about getting infected by cookies, writes @JamesHamblin. https://t.co/OgvbB9yKsS

name: TheAtlantic
text: Abolishing the controversial Electoral College seems out of the question. But there is still a way around it, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/EuBxCDA3Og

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Talking about books isn’t talking about just a retail marketplace, but also the marketplace of ideas—of art, free speech, and, yes, damn it, democracy itself," @MobyLives writes: https://t.co/tfbh3lU5kF

name: TheAtlantic
text:
In the latest edition of the Weekly Planet, @yayitsrob explores the history of energy in the US, including how horses got absolutely ripped.  https://t.co/l48mQHv5xM 

To receive this newsletter in your inbox each week, sign up here: https://t.co/WNioCjX7uX

name: TheAtlantic
text: With “Happiest Season,” a holiday rom-com about queer joy, the director Clea DuVall crashed a thoroughly straight genre. @shirklesxp talks to DuVall about what led her to this point after 20 years in Hollywood: https://t.co/1v9uKW6zF9

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: Unfathomably tragic, especially this: "These fatality numbers do not reflect any increased spread from Thanksgiving. Statistical analyses have found that deaths tend to rise roughly three weeks after confirmed cases." https://t.co/67cevGkWXR

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @edyong209: More than 3000 deaths recorded in the US today. 

This reflects infections that happened in mid-November, before Thanksgiving.

That number is going to get higher.

https://t.co/W5vHNPWABI https://t.co/AZRMG7jUaa

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Yesterday, for the first time, states reported more than 3,000 COVID-19 deaths. "There is no doubt now: This is the worst moment of the pandemic so far," write @slaskow and @alexismadrigal.

The latest data from @COVID19Tracking: https://t.co/4XjjGY5Oms
